title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 159.13 - Recordkeeping
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 159.13 - Recordkeeping

State Regulations
(a) A licensee
shall create, maintain, and make available accurate records, in a form and at a
location satisfactory to the Commissioner, and which sets forth the following
information: (i) a description of the
registered premises where hemp is grown; (ii)
the name of the cultivar(s) grown, and
the number of plants of each cultivar purchased, acquired, and used, for the
applicable growing season; (iii)
the amount and acreage of hemp grown during each growing season; (iv)
the amount and acreage of hemp disposed
of on a yearly basis, including, but not limited to the hemp disposed of
pursuant to ยง
159.12
of this Part; and
(v) the results of all required
testing. (b) The

Department shall collect and maintain information for each grower licensed or
authorized to produce as set forth in Section
159.4
(a)(i) and
(ii), as well as the status and number of
each grower's license. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
159.13

Adopted

New

York State Register April 6, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 14, eff. 4/6/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
